statement: Adding 2–3 architecture diagrams (e.g., system context, LLM ledger flow, policy/infra sync loop) will materially improve README clarity for new contributors and operators.
rationale: The system has multiple interacting modules (lab, Convex domain/platform, provider adapters, analysis) and a multi-step ledger flow that is hard to grasp without visuals.
keyAssumptions: Mermaid diagrams are acceptable for the repo’s README tooling.
validationCriteria: README includes at least one system overview diagram and one ledger flow diagram that match the refactored structure.
critiquePoints: Diagrams can drift if not maintained; they must be high-level and stable.
questions: Should diagrams live in README or in a dedicated docs/architecture file with a README link?
